newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks inactive.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks inactive.

text.p: An up-and-down day on Wall Street seemed to leave traders bereft of momentum after the bell Thursday, as few stocks were moving, traders said.

Microsoft Corp was up 3-1/8 to 95-1/8 during regular trading hours as the technology-heavy Nasdaq index gained almost 13 points, or one percent. International Business Machines Corp was down 2-3/8 to 131-3/8 as the Dow Jones index fell about 40 points, or 0.6 percent.
But neither stock was active in after-hours trading.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 15,900, while on Wednesday it was 74,400. Session two volume was 2,516,541, compared to 5,152,784 on Wednesday.
The American Stock Exchange said its after-hours volume was 500.
